RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUM CHARM was sharp out of the gates, settled just off of the pace and stalked the speed, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole,, took the lead by the quarter pole, willingly finished down the lane for the win. TWISTED BRADE broke tot he right was quickly corrected, dropped over to the rail, found racing room and raced on the rail, rushed quickly to catch up with the leader by the quarter pole, was in contention then faded by the eighth pole. LAST PENALTY was odd a bit slow, trailed the field, raced in the five path, steadily improved position, gained ground with every call, was able to get up for third. THE X FACTOR raced off of the pace in the five path, improved position down the back side, shifted into the two path at the three eighths pole, saved ground through the turn, closed well on the rail just missing for third. BABY LOCKOUT vied for the lead, settled in between rivals and stalked the leader, stayed on the front end until the three eighths pole, could not sustain the bid and tired. FANCY HILL vied for the lead, raced in the rail, set the pace under pressure, then faded. IRISH WRIT was off in mid pack, raced in the four path then faltered. MALLORI'S MAGIC raced from off of the pace in the sixth path and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Hill
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Heath Aaron and Campbell Sheena

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Writ
ENTRY.OWNER: L and N Racing LLC and Brewster Clark O

ENTRY.NAME: Twisted Brade
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke right, rail, rushed up, in contention 3-16th, tired 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Last Penalty
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, 5w, improved position, up in time for third

ENTRY.NAME: The X Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mid pack, 5w, shifted 2 wide, turn, saved ground, 5wupp

ENTRY.NAME: Sum Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, settled, 3w, stalked, bid 5-16th, led 1/4, willingly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 17000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS JANA kept increasing pace throughout the race while following the three path around the track. MISS KENNEDY stayed off pace behind MISS JANA, ran mostly in the two path came into the stretch in the four path. CATCAKE had a late rally coming on to the stretch and caught up to MISS KENNEDY. SERIOUSLY SAM raced evenly on the rail, got caught at the sixteenth pole. SWEET VIDALIA maintained a fair pace throughout race, didn't make a move to progress to podium. SHE'S GONE D'WILD trailed throughout the race. G'S SQUEEZE dueled at the beginning of the race, then faded at the start of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Catcake
ENTRY.OWNER: BW and HTS Stables LLC and Grudzien Jason G

ENTRY.NAME: G's Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled faded at the start of the turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.

CLAIM.OWNER: Westmark Richard N and Westmark Mary S

RACE.FOOTNOTES: STOVALL vied for the lead, raced on the rail ,set all the fractions, was on the lead going into the stretch and bever waivered, winning impressively. COUNTRY GUY vied for the lead, stalked from the rail, saved ground through out, advanced through the turn, cleared the second place horse by the three sixteenth pole, was kept on point and finished well taking second place honors. CLEARING CUSTOMS raced in between foes in the two path, was mid pack, hit his best stride late and finished well down the lane getting third place. JACK THE WHISTLE stalked the pace while racing in the three path, shifted into the four path in the upper stretch then tired. YAKETY YAK raced from mid pack in the four path, raced in between rivals, gained mildly. WINONESOON was off mid pack, raced on the rail, saved ground and ran an even race. AUTUMN ROB raced mid pack in the four path, raced in between foes and had no kick. NOT LIKELY was off in the middle of the field, raced in the five path on the outside of the third tier pf rivals but never got involved. MINOR DISCREPANCY raced from off of the pace, raced in the four path and showed little. FRUIT CUP raced from off of the pace in the six path and made no impact. HERCULES N LOVE stalked the front runners from the four path, was forwardly place, maintained position until the five sixteenth pole then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Country Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, rail, saved ground, advanced, cleared 3-16th 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Clearing Customs
ENTRY.COMMENT: between, 2w, mid pack, best stride late, up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Autumn Rob
ENTRY.OWNER: Autumn Hill Farms Racing Stables, Inc.
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, between, had no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Stovall
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC Joey Foster Racing and Farm LLC Hope Haven Racing and Reunit
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, set the fractions, never waivered, best

ENTRY.NAME: Not Likely
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, outside, was never involved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on th e main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COCAL maintained a comfortable pace in the two path to secure the win. ANGOLA VACATION ran evenly had a late rally on the stretch to place. SPARKIN ran off pace on the rail got caught with seventy yards by ANGOLA VACATION. OWEN THE ICE MAN maintained even pace throughout race on the outside. CLEARLY A JET ran on the rail off stride of OWEN THE ICE MAN. WILD FIST ran in the four path all the way around the track no threat to the other runners.

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkin
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, caught at mid stretch off pace

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LETSTAKEITOUTSIDE stalked the leader form the three path, raced between rivals on the front end, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, split rivals at the quarter pole, drew next to the leaders and challenged for the lead at the eighth pole, battled and prevailed by the sixteenth pole and came home the winner. GILDERSLEEVE stalked the front runner from the four path, raced in between horses, maintained his position, launched a bid at the quarter pole, matched strides with the eventual winner, could not sustain the bid to over come the winner but did clear the rest of the field and came away with the place spot. ONE TOUGH CHARLIE vied for the lead, raced in the two path, matched strides and led in a set with a rival to the inside, shook the inside rival and led at the five sixteenth pole, was still in the lead entering the stretch by a fractional margin, was collared at the eighth pole, battled briefly, then relinquished the lead and finished third today. CHROMPTON stalked the pace setters from the rail, raced on the inside of the second tier, maintained his position through out. G'S STORM stalked the pace from the five path, was on the outside int he second tier, went widest through the turn, made no impact in the stretch run. SILVER CHALICE vied for the lead, raced in the two path, set the pace while working in a set with another rival to the outside, matched strides until the five sixteenth pole then gave way. SWIFT N TRAFFIC raced from off of the pace early on, raced on the rail, advanced and gained ground down the back side, was in contention by the three eighths pole but to no avail. OSCAR CHOICE end up off of the pace, raced in between foes in the two path, shifted into the four path in the upper stretch but made no impact. PERFECT TOM stalked the pace setting set from the two path, was in the second tier for competitors, had no kick. XANTHUS WRATH raced from off of the pace in the four path and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Swift N Traffic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, advanced backside, but to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Oscar Choice
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, between, 2w, 4 wide, upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Letstakeitoutside
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, between, bid 1/4, split, challenged 1/8, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Gildersleeve
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w,between, maintained, bid 1/4, could not sustain bid

ENTRY.NAME: One Tough Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, set, shook rival, led 5-16th, battled, relinquished 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: G's Storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Gustafson, Dawn M. and Darwin L.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 5w, outside 2nd tier, widest, made no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GHOSTLY TIME ran in the three path the whole race, surpassed foe at the sixteenth pole with a strong driving finish. HOLUS BOLUS ran off pace on the rail until the stretch then matched the pace of GHOSTLY TIME to place. MR. SHORTY set early pace in the two path, then slowly coasted at the eighth pole. MAKE IT SPEND IT ran on the rail mid pack then had a late rally between the eighth and sixteenth poles. BANDERA BLING gained gradually throughout the race, dueled at the end against MAKE IT SPEND IT. FUNNYFLAME ran in the four path the whole race had a very mild gain late in the race. SCAT FREE ran mid pack with a good pace then slowed mid way thru the turn. YES JACK ran in the four path majority of the race then faded in the middle of the turn. BLAME DENNIS trailed throughout. SNIMM never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Make It Spend It
ENTRY.OWNER: Robison J Kirk and Robison Judy

ENTRY.NAME: Snimm
ENTRY.OWNER: Jordan Will Cody and Jordan Anita A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since July 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIME TO MOVE stalked the from the rail, shifted into the four path entering the stretch, was patient, was given the cue an pounced, collaring the early leader and taking the lea finishing with the win. STOCKPILER was off in the middle of the field, raced four wide, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, went with the eventual winner, not enough for the win but was second best. CHICKEN TRUCK raced from off of the pace, mase one long clean run, gained ground with every call, had to much work to do. CRIMSON STORM vied for the lead, led while racing on the rail, set the pace, led into the furlong ground, was collared at the eighth pole and gave way. SHADY GRADY stalked, 3w, gave way. STELLAR TAP mid pack, raced three wide but made no impact. MAJOR DEAL off pace, ran even. DECLARE WAR off pace, rail, showed little. CHIEF ALPHA mid pack, faded. BOSSHOG THEM DUKES was mid pack, raced between horses , went wrong, pulled up and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Bosshog Them Dukes
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, went wrong, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Move
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, shifted 4 wide, upper, patient, challenged, prevai

ENTRY.NAME: Chicken Truck
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, steady clean trip, gained ground evey call

ENTRY.NAME: Stockpiler
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 3/8, closed well up for 2nd
